comments:
I have multiple editors open using IStorageEditorInput objects that contain 
EMF objects, not file resources. When I delete a parent EMF object in one 
editor I have adapters in the child editors to detect the deletion of the 
parent and automatically close. This was working in 3.0.1 (or 3.1M1 not sure 
when it broke). However with the 3.1M2 build I am seeing the following 
exception. The exception however only occurs if I am closing multiple child 
editors with the delete of a parent object. 

When the exception occurs I noticed in the debugger that the CTabItem object 
contained the name of a editor that was closed in its shortendText field

           shortenedText= "AvayaPBX" - This was the name of one of the editors 
that was closed


org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Graphic is disposed
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2691)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:2616)

	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2440)

This is an application error.  You must set the Image in the CTabItem to null 
before disposing the CTabItem OR you must wait till you get the Dispose 
callback for the CTabItem before disposing the image.   Disposing the image 
before the CTabItem is done with it is an invalid use of the CTabFolder.  
Moving to the UI team for possible error in Workbench Framework.

Would you be able to narrow down which build caused the problem?  Without your 
source code, it will be hard to figure out where to start looking.  If you can 
narrow down which integration build introduced the problem, it would be very 
helpful.
